elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "Job application".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What does an application dossier contain?
elements.correctAnswer: Letter of application (cover letter), curriculum vitae in tabular form, copies of all references, copies of professional or academic qualifications, copies of diplomas/certificates of further education, references (recommendations)

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What are references?
elements.correctAnswer: The word "reference" comes from the French and means report or information. It refers to a qualifying assessment given by a person of trust and the person or institution that can be consulted for the assessment.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Name four contents of the application letter?
elements.correctAnswer: The letter of application contains the information to which the application relates, the reasons why you want the advertised position and why you have chosen the company in question, your personal knowledge, skills, professional experience, etc. and your current position and activities.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What do you pay attention to when presenting your CV?
elements.correctAnswer: When writing a CV, care should be taken to be brief, avoid repetition and negative, pessimistic or inaccurate statements. The CV should also be appealing to the eye, as it is a personal business card. A pleasant layout includes sufficient space between the lines and the choice of a suitable font (e.g. Arial) and size (e.g. 12 "pitch").
